Key Match Events: Elias Sepho Mokwana put Bafana in the lead just before half time.
A lapse of concentration by Rushwin Dortley and Grant Kekana at the back gave Congolese striker Andre Bassouamina enough room to level matters deep into referee’s first-half optional time.
Mokwana should have scored earlier after the Congo defence let him run through but shot wide.
Bafana defender Rushwin Dortley also saw his header cleared off the line after he had connected well with Oswin Appolli’s corner kick.
Congo had to win this match to keep their hopes of qualifying alive and came close to finding the winner through their skipper, Ganvoula Mboussy, but his shot went wide with a few minutes remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: Bafana Bafana will have to beat Uganda in Kampala in November to ensure consecutive qualification for the Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) after playing to a 1-1 draw against Republic of Congo at Stade Alphonse Massamba-Debat de Brazzaville on Tuesday.
If Bafana fail to get victory in Kampala on November 11 they will have another chance to qualify ahead of the Congo as long as they beat South Sudan at home on November 19.
Post-Match Reflections: Bafana were held in Brazzaville by the team they were expected to wallop after they had trashed them 5-0 in Gqeberha last Friday.
Coach Avram Grant’s Zambia claimed an important 1-0 win over Chad to take a big step towards qualification thanks to Kennedy Musonda’s goal 20 minutes from the end.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Senegal had 30 attempts at goal against their hosts but it took until the final seconds for Sadio Mane to seal victory with a 20m free-kick that curled around the wall and into the bottom corner of the net.
Ghana slumped to a 2-0 loss against Sudan in neutral Libya as Ahmed Al-Tash and Mohamed Abdel Rahman scored within three minutes of each other in the second half.
Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) qualified after a 2-0 victory in Tanzania as Meschack Elia scored a brace, his first in the 88th minute and the second deep into stoppage time.
Gabon are also on course after a 2-0 win over Lesotho in neutral Durban, with Shavy Babicka and Rody Effaghe grabbing goals in the second half.
